whatIsService.title: What Is GFC Therapy?
whatIsService.content:
GFC Therapy (Growth Factor Concentrate Therapy) is an advanced, autologous (your own blood-derived) treatment that harnesses the power of natural growth factors to stimulate healing, regeneration, and rejuvenation.

A small amount of your blood is processed in a special kit to extract a highly concentrated solution of platelet-derived growth factors. These growth factors are then injected into the scalp (for hair regrowth) or skin (for scars, wrinkles, or dullness).

Compared to traditional PRP, **GFC** **Therapy** **in** **Pune** is more refined, more concentrated, and delivers better, faster results - with minimal discomfort and zero risk of allergies.

At The Skin Firm, Pune, we offer GFC Therapy for both hair restoration and skin rejuvenation, using advanced kits under dermatologist supervision.

faqs.title: FAQs on GFC Therapy in Pune

questions.question: What is the difference between GFC and PRP?
questions.answer: Both use your blood, but GFC is more refined and concentrated, with higher growth factor yield and better results.

questions.question: Is GFC Therapy safe?
questions.answer: Yes - since it uses your own blood-derived growth factors, it is completely safe and natural.

questions.question: How many sessions are required?
questions.answer: For hair, 4-6 sessions are recommended. For skin, 3-4 sessions give visible improvements.

questions.question: When will I see results?
questions.answer: Hair fall reduces within weeks; new growth shows in 2-3 months. Skin results appear in 3-4 weeks.

questions.question: Is GFC Therapy painful?
questions.answer: Mild pricks are felt, but numbing cream makes it comfortable.

questions.question: Does it work for advanced baldness?
questions.answer: It works best for early to moderate hair loss. Advanced baldness may need hair transplant.

questions.question: Can GFC help under-eye dark circles?
questions.answer: Yes - it improves pigmentation and hollowness naturally.

questions.question: Are results permanent?
questions.answer: Results are long-lasting, but maintenance sessions may be needed yearly.

questions.question: Is there downtime?
questions.answer: Minimal - you can resume daily routine the next day.

questions.question: Can men and women both get GFC?
questions.answer: Yes - it is equally safe and effective for both.
